author: Daniel Pearson
title: Netflix Is Replacing Its Star Ratings With Thumbs up or Thumbs Down
text:
Netflix is preparing to replace its star ratings system with a more simple thumbs up and thumbs down process.
All previous ratings will still be used to personalize the profiles of Netflix users, but soon you won’t be able to rate any content using the stars. Instead, you’ll only be able to give a positive or negative response. The move will likely be frowned upon by serious critics, though Roger Ebert was fond of a similar — albeit a little more complex — system.
Netflix VP of Product Todd Yellin told journalists on Thursday: “We are addicted to the methodology of A/B testing. The result was that thumbs got 200% more ratings than the traditional star-rating feature.”
The streaming service is also introducing a new percent-match feature that will give you a “matching” score with any particular movie, like a dating site. For example, a movie closely aligned with the user’s taste may get a 98% match.
Watch out for both features arriving in the coming months.
